scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: I have this day received a traitor's judgment,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And by that name must die: yet, heaven bear witness,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And if I have a conscience, let it sink me,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Even as the axe falls, if I be not faithful!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: The law I bear no malice for my death;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: 'T has done, upon the premises, but justice:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: But those that sought it I could wish more Christians:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Be what they will, I heartily forgive 'em:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Yet let 'em look they glory not in mischief,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Nor build their evils on the graves of great men;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: For then my guiltless blood must cry against 'em.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: For further life in this world I ne'er hope,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Nor will I sue, although the king have mercies

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: More than I dare make faults. You few that loved me,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And dare be bold to weep for Buckingham,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: His noble friends and fellows, whom to leave

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Is only bitter to him, only dying,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Go with me, like good angels, to my end;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And, as the long divorce of steel falls on me,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Make of your prayers one sweet sacrifice,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And lift my soul to heaven. Lead on, o' God's name.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: I do beseech your grace, for charity,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: If ever any malice in your heart

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: Were hid against me, now to forgive me frankly.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Sir Thomas Lovell, I as free forgive you

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: As I would be forgiven: I forgive all;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: There cannot be those numberless offences

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: 'Gainst me, that I cannot take peace with:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: no black envy

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Shall mark my grave. Commend me to his grace;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And if he speak of Buckingham, pray, tell him

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: You met him half in heaven: my vows and prayers

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Yet are the king's; and, till my soul forsake,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Shall cry for blessings on him: may he live

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Longer than I have time to tell his years!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Ever beloved and loving may his rule be!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And when old time shall lead him to his end,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Goodness and he fill up one monument!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: To the water side I must conduct your grace;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: Then give my charge up to Sir Nicholas Vaux,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: LOVELL
line: Who undertakes you to your end.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: VAUX
line: Prepare there,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: VAUX
line: The duke is coming: see the barge be ready;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: VAUX
line: And fit it with such furniture as suits

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: VAUX
line: The greatness of his person.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Nay, Sir Nicholas,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Let it alone; my state now will but mock me.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: When I came hither, I was lord high constable

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And Duke of Buckingham; now, poor Edward Bohun:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Yet I am richer than my base accusers,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: That never knew what truth meant: I now seal it;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And with that blood will make 'em one day groan for't.

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: My noble father, Henry of Buckingham,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Who first raised head against usurping Richard,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Flying for succor to his servant Banister,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Being distress'd, was by that wretch betray'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And without trial fell; God's peace be with him!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Henry the Seventh succeeding, truly pitying

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: My father's loss, like a most royal prince,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Restored me to my honours, and, out of ruins,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Made my name once more noble. Now his son,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Henry the Eighth, life, honour, name and all

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: That made me happy at one stroke has taken

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: For ever from the world. I had my trial,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And, must needs say, a noble one; which makes me,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: A little happier than my wretched father:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Yet thus far we are one in fortunes: both

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Fell by our servants, by those men we loved most;

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: A most unnatural and faithless service!

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Heaven has an end in all: yet, you that hear me,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: This from a dying man receive as certain:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Where you are liberal of your loves and counsels

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Be sure you be not loose; for those you make friends

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And give your hearts to, when they once perceive

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: The least rub in your fortunes, fall away

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Like water from ye, never found again

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: But where they mean to sink ye. All good people,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Pray for me! I must now forsake ye: the last hour

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Of my long weary life is come upon me. Farewell:

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: And when you would say something that is sad,

scene: SCENE I.  Westminster. A street.
speaker: BUCKINGHAM
line: Speak how I fell. I have done; and God forgive me!

speaker: Second Gentleman
line: I am confident,

speaker: CRANMER
line: Than this pure soul shall be: all princely graces,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: That mould up such a mighty piece as this is,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: With all the virtues that attend the good,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Shall still be doubled on her: truth shall nurse her,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Holy and heavenly thoughts still counsel her:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: She shall be loved and fear'd: her own shall bless her;

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Her foes shake like a field of beaten corn,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: And hang their heads with sorrow: good grows with her:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: In her days every man shall eat in safety,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Under his own vine, what he plants; and sing

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: The merry songs of peace to all his neighbours:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: God shall be truly known; and those about her

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: From her shall read the perfect ways of honour,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: And by those claim their greatness, not by blood.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Nor shall this peace sleep with her: but as when

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Her ashes new create another heir,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: As great in admiration as herself;

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: So shall she leave her blessedness to one,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: When heaven shall call her from this cloud of darkness,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Who from the sacred ashes of her honour

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Shall star-like rise, as great in fame as she was,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: And so stand fix'd: peace, plenty, love, truth, terror,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: That were the servants to this chosen infant,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Shall then be his, and like a vine grow to him:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Wherever the bright sun of heaven shall shine,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: His honour and the greatness of his name

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Shall be, and make new nations: he shall flourish,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: And, like a mountain cedar, reach his branches

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: To all the plains about him: our children's children

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Shall see this, and bless heaven.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: Thou speakest wonders.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: She shall be, to the happiness of England,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: An aged princess; many days shall see her,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: And yet no day without a deed to crown it.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: Would I had known no more! but she must die,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: She must, the saints must have her; yet a virgin,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: A most unspotted lily shall she pass

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: CRANMER
line: To the ground, and all the world shall mourn her.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: O lord archbishop,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: Thou hast made me now a man! never, before

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: This happy child, did I get any thing:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: This oracle of comfort has so pleased me,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: That when I am in heaven I shall desire

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: To see what this child does, and praise my Maker.

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: I thank ye all. To you, my good lord mayor,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: And your good brethren, I am much beholding;

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: I have received much honour by your presence,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: And ye shall find me thankful. Lead the way, lords:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: Ye must all see the queen, and she must thank ye,

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: She will be sick else. This day, no man think

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: Has business at his house; for all shall stay:

scene: SCENE V.  The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY VIII
line: This little one shall make it holiday.
